submission.balance: $197,620.21 of USDC into the CASH-USDC LP.
submission.messageText:
1. 0x518098A2B3E0b8627543401490D78Ea97A2DedF6
2. D4HqKo2pKis4ndQEAG2BnioyVkBoYMaRHiBzxMf3MSt9
3. My wallet holds the CASH-USDC LP tokens in the wallet provided in #2
4.3SUNvDC9CTKgFEuThZTDRyXTg9U3sjozF9ATxsu1ZVWEVRtjXtQviVM1mcQ6FAEF1RGks8Dn8kp37Lfc2PPqmNo8 - this is the TXN Signature showing conversion on March 10, 2022 from USDC to the CASH-USDC LP token. I have not sold the LP tokens, I unstaked the LP after the exploit. 
5. $197,620.21 of USDC into the CASH-USDC LP.
6. I am not rich (and not a "crypto millionaire" like so many). I need this money. I am a working father with a toddler and newborn. I took my savings and moved it onto the blockchain for a "safe" way to find investment yields without the risk of the market (my savings account was giving me no return). I moved this money onto the blockchain from my savings account (fiat to FTX over to Phantom). I need this money back because it is the support for my family, which is what I work so hard for (just like every dad, I hope if something happens to me, this savings will help my family get by). Last year we had our second child and the year before that I had open heart surgery, both of these years had very expensive medical bills which I make monthly payments on. Looking back I wish I would have used this money to pay off medical bills rather than trying to earn interest to pay them off. The honest answer is I need this money back because it took me many years to earn this amount and I have payment obligations that I need the money for (or the interest I was earning on it, which I was "farming" almost daily"). I don't come from money (both parents work at grocery stores and are still working) and general life expenses (and kids) have made saving hard. I saw you returned all money to those under $100,000, which was the right thing to do - I hope you can do the same for those of us under $200,000. This money means a lot to me and my family.
